name: Baseband & Equalization
description: Sub-sector template for baseband signal processing patents (CPC H04L25*) including equalization, timing recovery, and channel estimation.
contextDescription: Baseband and equalization patents cover receiver signal processing. Key areas include linear equalization (FFE, CTLE), decision feedback equalization (DFE), timing recovery, and channel estimation. High-value targets include all SerDes vendors (Synopsys, Cadence, Rambus), PHY vendors, and high-speed interface implementers. Essential for every high-speed link.
scoringGuidance: DFE patents are in every high-speed SerDes.
CTLE patents are essential for channel compensation.
Timing recovery/CDR patents enable reliable data reception.
Adaptive equalization patents handle varying channel conditions.

questions.question: What equalization technique does this cover (FFE, DFE, CTLE, MLSE)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the equalization technique and its use cases.

questions.question: Is this applicable to PAM4 signaling? PAM4 is standard for 100G+ links.
questions.reasoningPrompt: PAM4 requires more sophisticated equalization than NRZ.

questions.question: Does this enable adaptive equalization or channel tracking?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Adaptation is essential for production-worthy links.

questions.question: Does this improve power efficiency of the receiver? Critical for high-density links.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Power is a key constraint for SerDes in data centers.
